meanings.definition: Covered with short, stiff hairs or bristles
meanings.sent1: His face felt stubbly after not shaving for a few days.
meanings.sent2: The cat's tongue licked my hand, feeling stubbly against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The stubbly grass tickled my toes as I walked through the field.
meanings.sent4: The stubbly surface of the rock scratched my palm as I climbed.
meanings.sent5: The stubbly texture of the carpet made it uncomfortable to sit on.

meanings.definition: Having a rough, prickly texture due to short, stiff hairs or bristles
meanings.sent1: The stubbly fabric of the old couch irritated my skin.
meanings.sent2: The stubbly surface of the fruit made it unappealing to touch.
meanings.sent3: She joked that his stubbly beard felt like a cactus on her cheek.
meanings.sent4: The stubbly leaves of the plant rustled in the wind like tiny needles.
meanings.sent5: The stubbly sensation of the carpet reminded me of walking on sandpaper.
